message.content:
Implement the following plan: # Post-Deploy: Logos, Watermark, 3D Axes, Button Layout, Banner, Word Count ## Context Six issues visible post-deployment need fixes: title page logos crash if file missing, sandbox watermark is ugly instead of branded, 3D scatter axes clip the container, editor buttons shift when messages appear, licence banner has poor contrast, and word count includes BibTeX trailer. --- ## Change 1: Logo Fallback in CLS Files **Files**: `templates/sskm-thesis.cls` (lines 349-351), `templates/ssuhs-thesis.cls` (lines 382-389), `apps/web/lib/latex/generate-tex.ts` (line 54-58) **Problem**: If logo path is set but file doesn't exist on disk, `\includegraphics` crashes compilation. **Fix in both CLS files** — add a safe helper after the setter commands (~line 210/226): ```latex \newcommand{\@includelogoifexists}[2]{% \IfFileExists{#1.pdf}{\includegraphics[width=#2]{#1}\\[0.4cm]}{% \IfFileExists{#1.png}{\includegraphics[width=#2]{#1}\\[0.4cm]}{% \IfFileExists{#1.jpg}{\includegraphics[width=#2]{#1}\\[0.4cm]}{}}}% } ``` Replace `\includegraphics` calls in title page: - `sskm-thesis.cls:350` → `\@includelogoifexists{\universitylogopath}{4.5cm}` - `ssuhs-thesis.cls:383` → `\@includelogoifexists{\universitylogopath}{4.5cm}` - `ssuhs-thesis.cls:388` → `\@includelogoifexists{\institutelogopath}{3.5cm}` **`generate-tex.ts`**: Add `generic` entry with empty logo paths: ```typescript generic: { university: "", institute: "" }, ``` --- ## Change 2: Branded Sandbox Watermark **File**: `apps/web/lib/latex/compile.ts` (lines 264-283, `injectWatermarkPackage`) **Problem**: Current sandbox watermark is "SANDBOX --- Apollo" in default font at 45° — looks like a warning, not branding. User wants elegant "Apollo" as stealth marketing. **Fix**: Use Palatino (`ppl`) — closest TeX Live serif to Playfair Display: ```typescript function injectWatermarkPackage( texContent: string, options: { watermark?: boolean; draftFooter?: boolean } ): string { if (!options.watermark && !options.draftFooter) return texContent; const beginDocIdx = texContent.indexOf("\\begin{document}"); if (beginDocIdx === -1) return texContent; let pkg: string; if (options.watermark) { // Sandbox: elegant centered "Apollo" in Palatino italic — stealth branding pkg = [ "\\usepackage{draftwatermark}", "\\SetWatermarkText{\\fontfamily{ppl}\\selectfont\\itshape Apollo}", "\\SetWatermarkColor[gray]{0.92}", "\\SetWatermarkScale{2.5}", "\\SetWatermarkAngle{0}", ].join("\n") + "\n"; } else { // Licensed draft: subtle bottom footer pkg = [ "\\usepackage{draftwatermark}", "\\SetWatermarkText{\\fontfamily{ppl}\\selectfont Generated with Apollo}", "\\SetWatermarkColor[gray]{0.88}", "\\SetWatermarkScale{0.3}", "\\SetWatermarkAngle{0}", ].join("\n") + "\n"; } return texContent.slice(0, beginDocIdx) + pkg + texContent.slice(beginDocIdx); } ``` --- ## Change 3: 3D Scatter Plot Axis Proportions **File**: `apps/web/components/landing/hero-3d-scene.tsx` (LOCKED — user approved this change) **Problem**: Z-axis hardcoded to 0.6 (data goes to z=1.30). X-axis at 2.2 clips container at 45° rotation. **Fix**: Replace single `AXIS_LENGTH` with per-axis constants: ```typescript const AXIS_LENGTH_X = 1.8; // Shorter — prevents clipping const AXIS_LENGTH_Y = 2.2; // Unchanged const AXIS_LENGTH_Z = 1.2; // Doubled — shows full depth ``` Update 9 locations: - **Tick loops** (lines 371, 374, 377): X→`AXIS_LENGTH_X`, Y→`AXIS_LENGTH_Y`, Z→`AXIS_LENGTH_Z` - **Axis lines** (lines 394-396): endpoints use respective constants - **Arrowheads** (lines 399-401): positions use respective constants --- ## Change 4: Stable Button Layout + Auto-Dismissing Messages **Files**: `compile-button.tsx`, `ai-generate-button.tsx`, `project-workspace.tsx` **Problem**: CompileButton and AIGenerateButton each stack button + status messages vertically (`space-y-2/3`) inside the action bar's horizontal flex. Messages appearing grow the stack, shifting sibling buttons and word count bar. **Fix**: Lift message rendering out of button components into a dedicated **status row ABOVE the button row**. Messages auto-dismiss after 8 seconds (success) or are dismissable via click (errors). ### 4A: `compile-button.tsx` - Add optional `onResult?: (r: CompileResult | null) => void` and `onError?: (e: string | null) => void` callback props - Call these when result/error state changes (in `handleCompile` and poll handler) - Remove the `{result && ...}` and `{error && ...}` JSX blocks from return - Keep only the button + queue badge inline (the `
` wrapper stays, the outer `
` goes) ### 4B: `ai-generate-button.tsx` - Add optional `onError?: (e: string | null) => void` callback prop - Call it when error state changes - Remove `{error &&

...}` from return JSX - Keep citation summary badge (it's contextually tied to the generate action) ### 4C: `project-workspace.tsx` (lines 393-442) Add state + auto-dismiss logic: ```typescript const [compileResult, setCompileResult] = useState(null); const [compileError, setCompileError] = useState(null); const [generateError, setGenerateError] = useState(null); // Auto-dismiss success messages after 8s useEffect(() => { if (!compileResult) return; const t = setTimeout(() => setCompileResult(null), 8000); return () => clearTimeout(t); }, [compileResult]); ``` Restructure layout — messages ABOVE buttons: ```tsx {/* Status messages — above button row, auto-dismiss / click-dismiss */} {(compileResult || compileError || generateError) && (

{compileResult && (
setCompileResult(null)} title="Click to dismiss" > Compiled successfully in {compileResult.compile_time_ms}ms {compileResult.warnings.length > 0 && ` (${compileResult.warnings.length} warnings)`}
)} {compileError && (
setCompileError(null)} title="Click to dismiss" > {compileError}
)} {generateError && (
setGenerateError(null)} title="Click to dismiss" > {generateError}
)}
)} {/* Action buttons — stable row, never shifts */}
{/* AIGenerateButton, Approve, CompileButton, ExportMenu */}
``` --- ## Change 5: Licence Banner Contrast **File**: `apps/web/components/project/licence-banner.tsx` (lines 24-42) **Problem**: `#D4A373` text on `#D4A373/10` bg — very low contrast on `#FAFAFA` dot-grid dashboard background. **Fix**: - Background: `bg-[#D4A373]/10` → `bg-[#FDF6EE]` (solid warm cream) - Border: `border-[#D4A373]/30` → `border-[#C8964C]/40` (slightly richer) - Heading: `text-[#D4A373]` → `text-[#92600A]` (dark amber — high contrast) - Body: `text-[#D4A373]/80` → `text-[#7A5F2A]` (dark warm brown) --- ## Change 6: Word Count Excludes BibTeX **File**: `apps/web/app/api/projects/[id]/sections/[phase]/route.ts` (lines 172-180) **Problem**: `countWords()` receives full `latex_content` including `---BIBTEX---` trailer. BibTeX entries inflate count (5,200 shown vs ~1,400 body-only). **Fix**: Split at separator before counting: ```typescript function countWords(latex: string): number { // Only count body — exclude BibTeX trailer const sepIdx = latex.indexOf("---BIBTEX---"); const body = sepIdx >= 0 ? latex.slice(0, sepIdx) : latex; const stripped = body .replace(/\\[a-zA-Z]+(\{[^}]*\})?/g, " ") .replace(/[{}\\%$&_^~#]/g, " ") .replace(/\s+/g, " ") .trim(); return stripped ? stripped.split(" ").length : 0; } ``` --- ## Implementation Order | Step | Change | Files | Complexity | |------|--------|-------|-----------| | 1 | Word count fix | `route.ts` | Trivial | | 2 | Licence banner contrast | `licence-banner.tsx` | Trivial | | 3 | 3D axis proportions | `hero-3d-scene.tsx` | Small | | 4 | Watermark branding | `compile.ts` | Small | | 5 | Logo fallback | `sskm-thesis.cls`, `ssuhs-thesis.cls`, `generate-tex.ts` | Medium | | 6 | Button layout stability | `compile-button.tsx`, `ai-generate-button.tsx`, `project-workspace.tsx` | Medium | ## Verification 1. **TypeScript**: `npx tsc --noEmit` — 0 errors 2. **Word count**: Section with BibTeX → word_count reflects body only (should drop from ~5,200 to ~1,400 for Introduction) 3. **Banner**: Heading and body text clearly readable against dashboard background 4. **3D scene**: Z-axis visibly longer, X-axis no longer clips container edge 5. **Watermark**: Sandbox compile → "Apollo" in elegant centred Palatino italic, very light grey 6. **Logos**: `generic` university → no logos, no crash. SSKM/SSUHS → logos show if files exist 7. **Buttons**: Compile success → message appears below button row, buttons don't shift If you need specific details from before exiting plan mode (like exact code snippets, error messages, or content you generated), read the full transcript at: /Users/devs/.REDACTED.jsonl

# Post-Deploy: Logos, Watermark, 3D Axes, Button Layout, Banner, Word Count ## Context Six issues visible post-deployment need fixes: title page logos crash if file missing, sandbox watermark is ugly instead of branded, 3D scatter axes clip the container, editor buttons shift when messages appear, licence banner has poor contrast, and word count includes BibTeX trailer. --- ## Change 1: Logo Fallback in CLS Files **Files**: `templates/sskm-thesis.cls` (lines 349-351), `templates/ssuhs-thesis.cls` (lines 382-389), `apps/web/lib/latex/generate-tex.ts` (line 54-58) **Problem**: If logo path is set but file doesn't exist on disk, `\includegraphics` crashes compilation. **Fix in both CLS files** — add a safe helper after the setter commands (~line 210/226): ```latex \newcommand{\@includelogoifexists}[2]{% \IfFileExists{#1.pdf}{\includegraphics[width=#2]{#1}\\[0.4cm]}{% \IfFileExists{#1.png}{\includegraphics[width=#2]{#1}\\[0.4cm]}{% \IfFileExists{#1.jpg}{\includegraphics[width=#2]{#1}\\[0.4cm]}{}}}% } ``` Replace `\includegraphics` calls in title page: - `sskm-thesis.cls:350` → `\@includelogoifexists{\universitylogopath}{4.5cm}` - `ssuhs-thesis.cls:383` → `\@includelogoifexists{\universitylogopath}{4.5cm}` - `ssuhs-thesis.cls:388` → `\@includelogoifexists{\institutelogopath}{3.5cm}` **`generate-tex.ts`**: Add `generic` entry with empty logo paths: ```typescript generic: { university: "", institute: "" }, ``` --- ## Change 2: Branded Sandbox Watermark **File**: `apps/web/lib/latex/compile.ts` (lines 264-283, `injectWatermarkPackage`) **Problem**: Current sandbox watermark is "SANDBOX --- Apollo" in default font at 45° — looks like a warning, not branding. User wants elegant "Apollo" as stealth marketing. **Fix**: Use Palatino (`ppl`) — closest TeX Live serif to Playfair Display: ```typescript function injectWatermarkPackage( texContent: string, options: { watermark?: boolean; draftFooter?: boolean } ): string { if (!options.watermark && !options.draftFooter) return texContent; const beginDocIdx = texContent.indexOf("\\begin{document}"); if (beginDocIdx === -1) return texContent; let pkg: string; if (options.watermark) { // Sandbox: elegant centered "Apollo" in Palatino italic — stealth branding pkg = [ "\\usepackage{draftwatermark}", "\\SetWatermarkText{\\fontfamily{ppl}\\selectfont\\itshape Apollo}", "\\SetWatermarkColor[gray]{0.92}", "\\SetWatermarkScale{2.5}", "\\SetWatermarkAngle{0}", ].join("\n") + "\n"; } else { // Licensed draft: subtle bottom footer pkg = [ "\\usepackage{draftwatermark}", "\\SetWatermarkText{\\fontfamily{ppl}\\selectfont Generated with Apollo}", "\\SetWatermarkColor[gray]{0.88}", "\\SetWatermarkScale{0.3}", "\\SetWatermarkAngle{0}", ].join("\n") + "\n"; } return texContent.slice(0, beginDocIdx) + pkg + texContent.slice(beginDocIdx); } ``` --- ## Change 3: 3D Scatter Plot Axis Proportions **File**: `apps/web/components/landing/hero-3d-scene.tsx` (LOCKED — user approved this change) **Problem**: Z-axis hardcoded to 0.6 (data goes to z=1.30). X-axis at 2.2 clips container at 45° rotation. **Fix**: Replace single `AXIS_LENGTH` with per-axis constants: ```typescript const AXIS_LENGTH_X = 1.8; // Shorter — prevents clipping const AXIS_LENGTH_Y = 2.2; // Unchanged const AXIS_LENGTH_Z = 1.2; // Doubled — shows full depth ``` Update 9 locations: - **Tick loops** (lines 371, 374, 377): X→`AXIS_LENGTH_X`, Y→`AXIS_LENGTH_Y`, Z→`AXIS_LENGTH_Z` - **Axis lines** (lines 394-396): endpoints use respective constants - **Arrowheads** (lines 399-401): positions use respective constants --- ## Change 4: Stable Button Layout + Auto-Dismissing Messages **Files**: `compile-button.tsx`, `ai-generate-button.tsx`, `project-workspace.tsx` **Problem**: CompileButton and AIGenerateButton each stack button + status messages vertically (`space-y-2/3`) inside the action bar's horizontal flex. Messages appearing grow the stack, shifting sibling buttons and word count bar. **Fix**: Lift message rendering out of button components into a dedicated **status row ABOVE the button row**. Messages auto-dismiss after 8 seconds (success) or are dismissable via click (errors). ### 4A: `compile-button.tsx` - Add optional `onResult?: (r: CompileResult | null) => void` and `onError?: (e: string | null) => void` callback props - Call these when result/error state changes (in `handleCompile` and poll handler) - Remove the `{result && ...}` and `{error && ...}` JSX blocks from return - Keep only the button + queue badge inline (the `
` wrapper stays, the outer `
` goes) ### 4B: `ai-generate-button.tsx` - Add optional `onError?: (e: string | null) => void` callback prop - Call it when error state changes - Remove `{error &&

...}` from return JSX - Keep citation summary badge (it's contextually tied to the generate action) ### 4C: `project-workspace.tsx` (lines 393-442) Add state + auto-dismiss logic: ```typescript const [compileResult, setCompileResult] = useState(null); const [compileError, setCompileError] = useState(null); const [generateError, setGenerateError] = useState(null); // Auto-dismiss success messages after 8s useEffect(() => { if (!compileResult) return; const t = setTimeout(() => setCompileResult(null), 8000); return () => clearTimeout(t); }, [compileResult]); ``` Restructure layout — messages ABOVE buttons: ```tsx {/* Status messages — above button row, auto-dismiss / click-dismiss */} {(compileResult || compileError || generateError) && (

{compileResult && (
setCompileResult(null)} title="Click to dismiss" > Compiled successfully in {compileResult.compile_time_ms}ms {compileResult.warnings.length > 0 && ` (${compileResult.warnings.length} warnings)`}
)} {compileError && (
setCompileError(null)} title="Click to dismiss" > {compileError}
)} {generateError && (
setGenerateError(null)} title="Click to dismiss" > {generateError}
)}
)} {/* Action buttons — stable row, never shifts */}
{/* AIGenerateButton, Approve, CompileButton, ExportMenu */}
``` --- ## Change 5: Licence Banner Contrast **File**: `apps/web/components/project/licence-banner.tsx` (lines 24-42) **Problem**: `#D4A373` text on `#D4A373/10` bg — very low contrast on `#FAFAFA` dot-grid dashboard background. **Fix**: - Background: `bg-[#D4A373]/10` → `bg-[#FDF6EE]` (solid warm cream) - Border: `border-[#D4A373]/30` → `border-[#C8964C]/40` (slightly richer) - Heading: `text-[#D4A373]` → `text-[#92600A]` (dark amber — high contrast) - Body: `text-[#D4A373]/80` → `text-[#7A5F2A]` (dark warm brown) --- ## Change 6: Word Count Excludes BibTeX **File**: `apps/web/app/api/projects/[id]/sections/[phase]/route.ts` (lines 172-180) **Problem**: `countWords()` receives full `latex_content` including `---BIBTEX---` trailer. BibTeX entries inflate count (5,200 shown vs ~1,400 body-only). **Fix**: Split at separator before counting: ```typescript function countWords(latex: string): number { // Only count body — exclude BibTeX trailer const sepIdx = latex.indexOf("---BIBTEX---"); const body = sepIdx >= 0 ? latex.slice(0, sepIdx) : latex; const stripped = body .replace(/\\[a-zA-Z]+(\{[^}]*\})?/g, " ") .replace(/[{}\\%$&_^~#]/g, " ") .replace(/\s+/g, " ") .trim(); return stripped ? stripped.split(" ").length : 0; } ``` --- ## Implementation Order | Step | Change | Files | Complexity | |------|--------|-------|-----------| | 1 | Word count fix | `route.ts` | Trivial | | 2 | Licence banner contrast | `licence-banner.tsx` | Trivial | | 3 | 3D axis proportions | `hero-3d-scene.tsx` | Small | | 4 | Watermark branding | `compile.ts` | Small | | 5 | Logo fallback | `sskm-thesis.cls`, `ssuhs-thesis.cls`, `generate-tex.ts` | Medium | | 6 | Button layout stability | `compile-button.tsx`, `ai-generate-button.tsx`, `project-workspace.tsx` | Medium | ## Verification 1. **TypeScript**: `npx tsc --noEmit` — 0 errors 2. **Word count**: Section with BibTeX → word_count reflects body only (should drop from ~5,200 to ~1,400 for Introduction) 3. **Banner**: Heading and body text clearly readable against dashboard background 4. **3D scene**: Z-axis visibly longer, X-axis no longer clips container edge 5. **Watermark**: Sandbox compile → "Apollo" in elegant centred Palatino italic, very light grey 6. **Logos**: `generic` university → no logos, no crash. SSKM/SSUHS → logos show if files exist 7. **Buttons**: Compile success → message appears below button row, buttons don't shift

content.text:
Now I need to export the `CompileResult` type from compile-button.tsx so workspace can use it. Actually, looking at the code, I defined a separate `CompileResultInfo` interface in project-workspace.tsx with just `warnings` and `compile_time_ms`, and the `setCompileResult` setter accepts anything matching that shape. The `CompileResult` from compile-button has `compilation_id` and `status` too, so `CompileResultInfo` is a subset — TypeScript will accept it since `onResult` in compile-button passes the full object which has those fields. Let me verify the types are compatible.

The `onResult` prop type in compile-button.tsx is `(r: CompileResult | null) => void` where `CompileResult` is `{compilation_id, status, warnings, compile_time_ms}`. The `setCompileResult` in workspace is `Dispatch<SetStateAction<CompileResultInfo | null>>` where `CompileResultInfo` is `{warnings, compile_time_ms}`. 

Since `setCompileResult` expects `CompileResultInfo | null`, and the actual argument passed will be a full `CompileResult` (which has extra fields), TypeScript should accept this since the extra fields are just ignored. But wait — `onResult` type is `(r: CompileResult | null) => void` and we're passing `setCompileResult` which is `(r: CompileResultInfo | null) => void`. TypeScript function params are contravariant, so passing a function that accepts a wider type is fine. `CompileResultInfo` is a subtype of `CompileResult`... no, it's a supertype (fewer fields). So `setCompileResult` accepts more values than `onResult` expects — that's fine.

Actually the issue is the other way: compile-button declares `onResult?: (r: CompileResult | null) => void` where `CompileResult` is a local interface. The workspace passes `setCompileResult` which accepts `CompileResultInfo | null`. Since `CompileResult` extends `CompileResultInfo` (has all its fields plus more), a function `(CompileResultInfo | null) => void` can handle `CompileResult | null` inputs. This works.

\newcommand{\universitylogo}[1]{\renewcommand{\universitylogopath}{#1}}
\newcommand{\institutelogo}[1]{\renewcommand{\institutelogopath}{#1}}

%% Safe logo inclusion — graceful fallback if file is missing
\newcommand{\@includelogoifexists}[2]{%
  \IfFileExists{#1.pdf}{\includegraphics[width=#2]{#1}\\[0.4cm]}{%
  \IfFileExists{#1.png}{\includegraphics[width=#2]{#1}\\[0.4cm]}{%
  \IfFileExists{#1.jpg}{\includegraphics[width=#2]{#1}\\[0.4cm]}{}}}%
}

%% Aliases for guide/supervisor terminology (backward compatibility)
\let\guidename\supervisorname
\let\guidedesignation\supervisordesignation

%% Aliases for co-guide/co-supervisor terminology
\let\coguidename\cosupervisorname
\let\coguidedesignation\cosupervisordesignation
\let\coguidedepartment\cosupervisordepartment

%% Aliases for principal/director/institution head terminology

content.text:
All changes implemented. Here's a summary of everything done:

## Changes Applied

### 1. Word Count — Excludes BibTeX (`route.ts:172-183`)
- `countWords()` now splits at `---BIBTEX---` separator before counting, so body-only word count is shown

### 2. Licence Banner Contrast (`licence-banner.tsx:24-42`)
- Background: `bg-[#D4A373]/10` → `bg-[#FDF6EE]` (solid warm cream)
- Border: `border-[#D4A373]/30` → `border-[#C8964C]/40`
- Heading: `text-[#D4A373]` → `text-[#92600A]` (dark amber)
- Body: `text-[#D4A373]/80` → `text-[#7A5F2A]` (dark warm brown)

### 3. 3D Scatter Axes (`hero-3d-scene.tsx:343-401`)
- Replaced single `AXIS_LENGTH=2.2` with per-axis: X=1.8, Y=2.2, Z=1.2
- Updated tick loops, axis lines, and arrowheads to use respective constants

### 4. Branded Watermark (`compile.ts:264-294`)
- Sandbox: "Apollo" in Palatino italic at 0°, scale 2.5, gray 0.92
- Licensed draft: "Generated with Apollo" in Palatino, scale 0.3, gray 0.88

### 5. Logo Fallback (`sskm-thesis.cls`, `ssuhs-thesis.cls`, `generate-tex.ts`)
- Added `\@includelogoifexists` helper that tries .pdf/.png/.jpg before silently skipping
- Replaced `\includegraphics` calls in title pages with safe helper
- Added `generic` entry with empty logo paths in `generate-tex.ts`

### 6. Stable Button Layout (`compile-button.tsx`, `ai-generate-button.tsx`, `project-workspace.tsx`)
- Added `onResult`/`onError` callback props to `CompileButton`
- Added `onError` callback prop to `AIGenerateButton`
- Removed inline result/error JSX from both button components
- Added status message row ABOVE the button row in `project-workspace.tsx`
- Messages auto-dismiss after 8s (success) or click-to-dismiss (errors)
- Button row is now stable — never shifts when messages appear/disappear

**TypeScript**: 0 errors confirmed.

# Apollo Web SaaS — CI Pipeline
# Runs on every PR and push to main
# Active: lint + type-check + unit tests
# Commented: security, RLS, compile, E2E (uncomment per sprint)

name: CI

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:
    branches: [main]

env:
  NODE_VERSION: '20'
  PNPM_VERSION: '9'

jobs:
  lint-and-typecheck:
    name: Lint & Type Check
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    defaults:
      run:
        working-directory: apps/web

    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup pnpm
        uses: pnpm/action-setup@v4
        with:
          version: ${{ env.PNPM_VERSION }}

      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          cache: 'pnpm'
          cache-dependency-path: apps/web/pnpm-lock.yaml

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: pnpm install --frozen-lockfile

      - name: Lint
        run: pnpm lint

      - name: Type check
        run: pnpm type-check

  unit-tests:
    name: Unit Tests
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: lint-and-typecheck
    defaults:
      run:
        working-directory: apps/web

    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup pnpm
        uses: pnpm/action-setup@v4
        with:
          version: ${{ env.PNPM_VERSION }}

      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          cache: 'pnpm'
          cache-dependency-path: apps/web/pnpm-lock.yaml

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: pnpm install --frozen-lockfile

      - name: Run unit tests
        run: pnpm test
        env:
          NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL: ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_URL }}
          NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY: ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_ANON_KEY }}

      - name: Upload coverage
        if: always()
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: coverage-report
          path: apps/web/coverage/
          retention-days: 7

  security-tests:
    name: Security & RLS Tests
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: unit-tests
    defaults:
      run:
        working-directory: apps/web

    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup pnpm
        uses: pnpm/action-setup@v4
        with:
          version: ${{ env.PNPM_VERSION }}

      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          cache: 'pnpm'
          cache-dependency-path: apps/web/pnpm-lock.yaml

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: pnpm install --frozen-lockfile

      - name: RLS tests
        run: pnpm test:rls
        env:
          NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL: ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_URL }}
          NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY: ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_ANON_KEY }}
          SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY: ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY }}

      - name: Security tests
        run: pnpm test:security
        env:
          NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL: ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_URL }}
          NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY: ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_ANON_KEY }}
          SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY: ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY }}
          CLERK_SECRET_KEY: ${{ secrets.CLERK_SECRET_KEY }}

  compile-test:
    name: Compile Test
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: unit-tests
    defaults:
      run:
        working-directory: apps/web

    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup pnpm
        uses: pnpm/action-setup@v4
        with:
          version: ${{ env.PNPM_VERSION }}

      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          cache: 'pnpm'
          cache-dependency-path: apps/web/pnpm-lock.yaml

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: pnpm install --frozen-lockfile

      - name: Run compile tests
        run: pnpm test:compile

  # Uncomment when Sprint 7+ adds Playwright
  # e2e-tests:
  #   name: E2E Tests (Playwright)
  #   runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  #   needs: unit-tests
  #   defaults:
  #     run:
  #       working-directory: apps/web
  #
  #   steps:
  #     - name: Checkout
  #       uses: actions/checkout@v4
  #
  #     - name: Setup pnpm
  #       uses: pnpm/action-setup@v4
  #       with:
  #         version: ${{ env.PNPM_VERSION }}
  #
  #     - name: Setup Node.js
  #       uses: actions/setup-node@v4
  #       with:
  #         node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
  #         cache: 'pnpm'
  #         cache-dependency-path: apps/web/pnpm-lock.yaml
  #
  #     - name: Install dependencies
  #       run: pnpm install --frozen-lockfile
  #
  #     - name: Install Playwright browsers
  #       run: npx playwright install --with-deps
  #
  #     - name: Run Playwright tests
  #       run: pnpm test:playwright
  #       env:
  #         NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL: ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_URL }}
  #         NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY: ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_ANON_KEY }}
  #
  #     - name: Upload test results
  #       if: failure()
  #       uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
  #       with:
  #         name: playwright-report
  #         path: apps/web/playwright-report/
  #         retention-days: 7

content.text:
Found the issue. Here's the full picture:

## Root Cause

**The lockfile is in the wrong place.** This is a pnpm workspace monorepo:

- `pnpm-workspace.yaml` at root declares `packages: ["apps/*"]`
- In a pnpm workspace, the **lockfile must be at the monorepo root** (`/pnpm-lock.yaml`), not inside `apps/web/`
- The lockfile currently lives at `apps/web/pnpm-lock.yaml` (and is tracked by git), but pnpm running at the root won't find it there
- The CI workflow sets `working-directory: apps/web` and runs `pnpm install --frozen-lockfile` — pnpm walks up to the repo root, sees `pnpm-workspace.yaml`, and looks for the lockfile at the root level. It's not there, so it fails with `ERR_PNPM_NO_LOCKFILE`.

The lockfile at `apps/web/` is a leftover from before the workspace was set up. pnpm ignores it.

## Impact on Deployment

**Depends on how Coolify deploys.** If Coolify uses git-push deploys with a `pnpm install` step, it'll hit the same issue. If it does a raw `docker build` that installs from scratch (without `--frozen-lockfile`), it'll work but won't have reproducible installs. The app itself runs fine — this only affects install-time reproducibility and CI.

## Fix

Generate the lockfile at the root where pnpm expects it, and remove the stale one from `apps/web/`:

# Apollo Web SaaS — CI Pipeline
# Runs on every PR and push to main
# Active: lint + type-check + unit tests
# Commented: security, RLS, compile, E2E (uncomment per sprint)

name: CI

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:
    branches: [main]

env:
  NODE_VERSION: '20'
  PNPM_VERSION: '9'

jobs:
  lint-and-typecheck:
    name: Lint & Type Check
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    defaults:
      run:
        working-directory: apps/web

    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup pnpm
        uses: pnpm/action-setup@v4
        with:
          version: ${{ env.PNPM_VERSION }}

      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          cache: 'pnpm'
          cache-dependency-path: apps/web/pnpm-lock.yaml

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: pnpm install --frozen-lockfile

      - name: Lint
        run: pnpm lint

      - name: Type check
        run: pnpm type-check

  unit-tests:
    name: Unit Tests
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: lint-and-typecheck
    defaults:
      run:
        working-directory: apps/web

    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup pnpm
        uses: pnpm/action-setup@v4
        with:
          version: ${{ env.PNPM_VERSION }}

      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          cache: 'pnpm'
          cache-dependency-path: apps/web/pnpm-lock.yaml

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: pnpm install --frozen-lockfile

      - name: Run unit tests
        run: pnpm test
        env:
          NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL: ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_URL }}
          NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY: ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_ANON_KEY }}

      - name: Upload coverage
        if: always()
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: coverage-report
          path: apps/web/coverage/
          retention-days: 7

  security-tests:
    name: Security & RLS Tests
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: unit-tests
    defaults:
      run:
        working-directory: apps/web

    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup pnpm
        uses: pnpm/action-setup@v4
        with:
          version: ${{ env.PNPM_VERSION }}

      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          cache: 'pnpm'
          cache-dependency-path: apps/web/pnpm-lock.yaml

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: pnpm install --frozen-lockfile

      - name: RLS tests
        run: pnpm test:rls
        env:
          NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL: ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_URL }}
          NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY: ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_ANON_KEY }}
          SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY: ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY }}

      - name: Security tests
        run: pnpm test:security
        env:
          NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL: ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_URL }}
          NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY: ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_ANON_KEY }}
          SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY: ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY }}
          CLERK_SECRET_KEY: ${{ secrets.CLERK_SECRET_KEY }}

  compile-test:

    needs: unit-tests
    defaults:
      run:
        working-directory: apps/web

    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

        with:

          cache-dependency-path: apps/web/pnpm-lock.yaml

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: pnpm install --frozen-lockfile

      - name: Run compile tests

content.text: The CI also runs with `working-directory: apps/web`, but `pnpm install --frozen-lockfile` from a subdirectory in a workspace still finds the root lockfile — that's correct behaviour. However, pnpm v9 (CI) vs v10 (local) could cause lockfile format mismatches. Let me check:
Local is pnpm 10, but CI pins `PNPM_VERSION: '9'`. pnpm 10 writes a lockfile format that pnpm 9 can't read. I need to align the CI to use pnpm 10:

          version: ${{ env.PNPM_VERSION }}

      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          cache: 'pnpm'
          cache-dependency-path: pnpm-lock.yaml

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: pnpm install --frozen-lockfile

      - name: RLS tests
        run: pnpm test:rls
        env:
          NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL: ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_URL }}
          NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY: ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_ANON_KEY }}
          SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY: ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY }}

      - name: Security tests
        run: pnpm test:security
        env:
          NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL: ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_URL }}
          NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY: ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_ANON_KEY }}
          SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY: ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY }}
          CLERK_SECRET_KEY: ${{ secrets.CLERK_SECRET_KEY }}

  compile-test:
    name: Compile Test
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: unit-tests
    defaults:
      run:
        working-directory: apps/web

    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup pnpm
        uses: pnpm/action-setup@v4
        with:
          version: ${{ env.PNPM_VERSION }}

      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
          cache: 'pnpm'
          cache-dependency-path: pnpm-lock.yaml

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: pnpm install --frozen-lockfile

      - name: Run compile tests
        run: pnpm test:compile

  # Uncomment when Sprint 7+ adds Playwright
  # e2e-tests:
  #   name: E2E Tests (Playwright)
  #   runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  #   needs: unit-tests
  #   defaults:
  #     run:
  #       working-directory: apps/web
  #
  #   steps:

  #
  #     - name: Setup pnpm
  #       uses: pnpm/action-setup@v4
  #       with:
  #         version: ${{ env.PNPM_VERSION }}
  #
  #     - name: Setup Node.js

  #       with:
  #         node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}
  #         cache: 'pnpm'
  #         cache-dependency-path: apps/web/pnpm-lock.yaml
  #
  #     - name: Install dependencies
  #       run: pnpm install --frozen-lockfile
  #
  #     - name: Install Playwright browsers
  #       run: npx playwright install --with-deps
  #
  #     - name: Run Playwright tests
  #       run: pnpm test:playwright
  #       env:
  #         NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL: ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_URL }}
  #         NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY: ${{ secrets.SUPABASE_ANON_KEY }}
  #
  #     - name: Upload test results
  #       if: failure()

  #       with:

  #         path: apps/web/playwright-report/

content.text: Also need to check `package.json` for a `packageManager` field — pnpm/action-setup can read it from there:
No `packageManager` field — the CI env var controls it. Now let me also remove the stale `apps/web/pnpm-lock.yaml` from git tracking since it's misleading:

input.command:
git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
Fix CI: move lockfile to monorepo root, align pnpm version to 10

The lockfile was at apps/web/ (pre-workspace leftover) but pnpm workspace
expects it at the repo root. CI also pinned pnpm 9 while local uses 10,
causing lockfile format incompatibility.

- Remove stale apps/web/pnpm-lock.yaml
- Generate pnpm-lock.yaml at monorepo root
- Update CI cache-dependency-path to pnpm-lock.yaml
- Bump CI PNPM_VERSION from 9 to 10

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"

content.thinking:
The exploration suggests the test shouldn't be broken by the sanitise call. Let me look more carefully at what `sanitiseLatexOutput` does to the test input. The test input is:

```
\section*{Patient Information Sheet and Informed Consent Form}
This is the PIS and ICF content.

\section*{Data Collection Proforma}
This is the proforma content.

\section*{Master Chart}
This is the master chart.
```

When `sanitiseLatexOutput` processes this, step 4 escapes bare `#` characters. But this input has none. The markdown heading conversions (`# Heading` → `\section{Heading}`) won't match either because the input uses `\section*{...}` format.
 
Actually, I'm realizing the issue now—the italic regex is looking for single asterisks, and the `\section*` contains one. The regex patterns for markdown bold and italic might be matching against those asterisks in the LaTeX commands themselves, which could corrupt the output. I'm checking whether the italic regex could accidentally match across multiple `\section*` commands by capturing everything between the first `*` in one section and the `*` in the next section, which would incorrectly treat the entire span as italicized content. I see the issue now — the `[^*]+` pattern is greedy and captures everything up to the next `*` character, which means it would match across multiple sections and consume content all the way to the `*` in `\section*{Data Collection Proforma}`, then match that `*` with the `\*` part of the regex. This would incorrectly treat a large block spanning multiple sections as a single italic block and destroy the structure. the `*` in `\section*` is being matched as a markdown italic delimiter. I need to fix the italic regex so it doesn't consume LaTeX commands — the cleanest approach is to add a negative lookbehind that prevents matching `*` when it's part of a backslash command sequence.

The real issue is that `\section*{...}` has the `*` preceded by a word character (the `n` in `section`), and markdown italic can legitimately appear mid-word, so a simple negative lookbehind won't work. I should temporarily protect these LaTeX patterns before applying the italic conversion.

My approach: replace `\command*{` sequences with a placeholder character, run the italic regex, then restore them afterward. This keeps the fix localized and doesn't require complex regex logic.

Implementing the protection logic... I'm working through the regex pattern to handle markdown italics without accidentally matching LaTeX commands like `\section*`. JavaScript does support variable-length lookbehind in modern Node.js, so I can use a pattern that excludes cases where the asterisk follows a backslash and letters.

Actually, the protect-and-restore approach is cleaner—I'll temporarily replace the asterisks in LaTeX starred commands with a placeholder, run the italic conversion, then restore them afterward. Refining the regex pattern...

I need to reconsider the lookbehind logic here. The pattern `(?<![a-zA-Z\\])` prevents matching `*` after letters or backslashes, which would correctly avoid `\section*` but might also block legitimate markdown italics like `word*italic*`. However, standard markdown actually requires the opening `*` to be at a word boundary or start of line, so this stricter approach aligns with proper markdown parsing. Let me verify what the current regex is actually checking for.

The issue is that the existing pattern only guards against consecutive `*` characters, not word boundaries. I should update the lookbehind to exclude both letters and `*` itself, and also add a newline restriction to prevent italic spans from crossing line breaks. This way `\section*` won't match because the `n` precedes it, and multi-line matches are prevented.

Now I need to check the actual file to apply this fix.

content.text:
The issue is clear. `sanitiseLatexOutput()` converts markdown italic `*text*` using a regex that accidentally matches `\section*{...}...\section*{...}` — the `*` in `\section*` acts as an italic delimiter, consuming the content between two starred commands.

Let me verify this theory and fix it:

content.text:
Confirmed. Line 35 is the bug. The italic regex `(?<!\*)\*([^*]+)\*(?!\*)` matches across lines and eats `\section*{...}...\section*{...}` because:

1. The `*` in `\section*` passes the lookbehind (`n` is not `*`)
2. `[^*]+` captures everything — including newlines — until the next `*`
3. The next `*` is in the *next* `\section*`, consuming the entire block between them

Two fixes needed:
- Don't match `*` preceded by a word character (LaTeX commands like `\section*`)
- Don't span newlines (markdown italic is single-line)

// 3. Convert markdown italic to LaTeX italic
  body = body.replace(/(?<!\*)\*([^*]+)\*(?!\*)/g, "\\textit{$1}");

content.text:
**All 4 CI jobs passed:**

| Job | Time | Status |
|-----|------|--------|
| Lint & Type Check | 39s | ✓ |
| Unit Tests | 36s | ✓ |
| Security & RLS Tests | 51s | ✓ |
| Compile Test | 19s | ✓ |

CI is fully green for the first time. The three fixes were:

1. **Lockfile location** — moved from `apps/web/pnpm-lock.yaml` (stale pre-workspace leftover) to root `pnpm-lock.yaml` where pnpm workspace expects it
2. **pnpm version mismatch** — CI pinned v9, local uses v10. Lockfile format is incompatible between major versions. Aligned CI to v10
3. **Italic regex bug** — `sanitiseLatexOutput()` markdown italic regex `(?<!\*)\*([^*]+)\*(?!\*)` consumed `\section*{...}...\section*{...}` as a single italic span, destroying appendices injection. Fixed by adding `(?<![a-zA-Z*])` lookbehind and `[^*\n]+` to prevent cross-line matching
